Detailed Description

Definition at line 20 of file Cassandra.hh.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Cassandra::Cassandra ( SparseMatrix *  actionTransitions,
SparseMatrix *  actionObservations,
SparseMatrix **  rewards,
int  numActions,
int  numStates,
int  numObservations,
float  discount = 0.95 
)

Construct a Cassandra Simulator with the given action and observation probability matricies.

Parameters:
actionTransitions,an array, of length numActions, of Action Transition probabilities from a start state (row index) to end state (column index). Each row must sum to 1.0.
actionObservations,an array, of length numActions, of Observation probabilities from a state (row index) to an end state (column index). Each row must sum to 1.0.

int Cassandra::doAction ( int  action  )  [virtual]

Perform the action with the specified index, generating a state and observation.

action, the index of the action to perform.

Reimplemented in BeliefStateCassandra, and PSRCassandra.

Definition at line 65 of file Cassandra.cc.

References actionObservations, actionTransitions, cheat, currAction, currObservation, currState, lastState, numActions, numObservations, and numStates.

void Cassandra::getObservation ( Observation &  obs  )  [virtual]

Returns an observation generated by the previous call to doAction.

Observations are found when the action is performed, not on a call to getObservation. Multiple calls to getObservation, without a call to doAction, will return the same observation.

Implements libpg::Simulator.

Reimplemented in BeliefStateCassandra, BlindCassandra, and PSRCassandra.

virtual int Cassandra::getObsCols (  )  [virtual]

Get the number of columns in the observation matrix Typically use multiple columns to provide a different observation to each agent, so the number of columns is the same as getAgents()

Implements libpg::Simulator.
